# Singular Value Decomposition

::: {.theorem  name=""}

If $\bm{\mathbf{A}}\in \mathbb{R}^{m\times n}$ of rank $r>0$, there exist orthogonal matrix $\bm{\mathbf{P}}\in \mathbb{R}^{m\times m}$ and $\bm{\mathbf{Q}}\in \mathbb{R}^{n\times n}$ $s.t.$ $\bm{\mathbf{A=PDQ'}}$ where $\bm{\mathbf{D}}$ is:
$$
\begin{cases}
    \Sigma & m=n=r\\
    \begin{bmatrix}
        \Sigma	& \bm{\mathbf{0}}	\\
    \end{bmatrix} & r=m<n\\
    \begin{bmatrix}
        \Sigma	\\
        	\bm{\mathbf{0}}\\
    \end{bmatrix}& r=n<m \\
    \begin{bmatrix}
        \Sigma	& \bm{\mathbf{0}} 	\\
        \bm{\mathbf{0}}	& \bm{\mathbf{0}} 	\\
    \end{bmatrix} & r<m,r<n
\end{cases}
$$
where $\Sigma \in \mathbb{R}^{r\times r}$ and is diagonal with positive entries, which are $\sqrt{\lambda_i}$ where $\lambda_i \in \sigma_{\bm{\mathbf{A'A}}}$

:::
